quote.quotepara: <xml:entity value="copy"/> and this will output © in the document.

body.para: You can't do that, as the output document won't be well-formed.

quote.quotepara: I tried every other thing I could think of to get this parsed (like &copy; but that resolves just like it is typed, also tried using CDATA for it, but © resolves to &copy;, etc).

body.para: What can be done is to output the tag itself and xsl can emit an © entity on this tag iff output mode was html (not xml). You don't have to do anything to achieve this (jelly would output any tag not known for it), only add the rule to the xsl script.
